body:
I would set this to 20 and copy the comment from poisson above.

**Details:** each loop of `sample_gamma()` (the Marsaglia-Tsang sampler) should terminate with probability > 90%. As I understand, in the worst case when we allocate too little overhead, we'll simply occasionally draw correlated samples (identical samples in two neighboring threads). I think it's reasonable for this to happen at a rate < 1e-4, so I believe 20 should account for the needed 4 retries.
